action.action-desc: Mrs. Love (for herself, Mr. Zeldin, Ms. Gabbard, Mr. Bishop of Michigan, Mr. Gowdy, Mr. Loudermilk, Mr. Babin, Mr. Chaffetz, Mr. Ratcliffe, Mr. Stewart, Mr. Curbelo of Florida, Mr. Bishop of Georgia, Mrs. Beatty, Mr. Zinke, Mrs. Roby, Mrs. Walorski, Mr. Hurd of Texas, Ms. Kelly of Illinois, Mr. Butterfield, Mr. Stivers, Mr. Yoder, Mr. Smith of Missouri, Ms. Moore, Ms. Fudge, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Richmond, Ms. Adams, Ms. Sinema, Ms. Brown of Florida, and Mr. Clyburn) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veteransâ€™ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to adjust the effective date of certain reductions and discontinuances of compensation, dependency and indemnity compensation, and pension under the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fair Treatment for Families of Veterans Act.

section.header: Effective date of certain reductions and discontinuances of compensation, dependency and indemnity compensation, and pension under laws administered by Secretary of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Section 5112(b)(1) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by striking last day of the month before and inserting last day of the month during which.

The amendment made by subsection (a) shall apply with respect to a reduction or discontinuance of compensation, dependency or indemnity compensation, or pension by reason of a marriage, remarriage, or death occurring on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
